results.justification: The document explicitly states the research methodology, including a Design Through Matchmaking approach and a mixed-methods design (qualitative interviews and quantitative SUS scores).
Sections 3.1-3.4 provide a detailed, step-by-step description of the study design, including the learning context, data collection, dashboard design, and user study procedures.
The document does not state that the raw or processed datasets are publicly available. It mentions a link to a supplementary material for the interview protocol, but not the data itself.
While privacy concerns are mentioned in the context of ethical considerations (Section 4.3), there is no explicit justification for *not* sharing the data.
Table 1 serves as a codebook explaining the spatial pedagogy behaviours observed and categorized. The document also describes the data collected (indoor positioning, voice activity, observations).
Data collection methods are fully described in Section 3.2 and 3.4, detailing the sensors used, observation procedures, and interview process.
The document provides a GitHub repository link for TeamTeachingViz: 'https://github.com/riordanalfredo/TeamTeachingViz'.
Code is shared, so this criterion is not applicable.
The document mentions the use of py-WebtcVAD and links to its GitHub repository, indicating code used for data preparation (voice activity detection).
The document describes the use of Cohen’s Kappa to assess inter-rater reliability (Section 3.2) and the calculation of SUS scores (Section 3.4.2).
The SUS average score and standard deviation are reported (Section 4.2). Cohen's Kappa value is also reported.
The document provides rich, subjective context and interpretation of the interview data, presenting themes and illustrative quotes from participants (Section 4.1 and 4.3).
The data analysis process is clearly described, detailing the use of deductive-inductive analysis and the coding scheme (Section 3.4.2).
Results are clearly presented in Section 4.1, 4.2, and 4.3, organized by research question and supported by quotes from participants.
Section 5.3 explicitly discusses limitations of the study, including the small sample size in the follow-up interviews and the reliance on human observations. Potential biases are also acknowledged.
The document does not contain a link to a preregistration on platforms like the Open Science Foundation.
